item.title: Palabra del día: ‘strident’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 109 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: ‘Más que rivales’ eleva la temperatura en el hockey y en el sexo
item.description: Un drama sobre el apasionado romance entre dos hombres jugadores de hockey profesionales, ha sido un éxito sorpresa para HBO Max.
item.dc:creator: Erik Piepenburg

media:content.media:credit: Ryan Pfluger para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Más que rivales ha supuesto un cambio de vida para las estrellas Hudson Williams, izquierda, y Connor Storrie.

item.title: Word of the Day: strident
item.description: This word has appeared in 109 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Discurso de Carney en Davos: Canadá busca nuevos aliados
item.description: El primer ministro Mark Carney fue ovacionado en Davos por describir con aspereza el final de la Pax Americana. Está buscando nuevos aliados para ayudar a su país a sobrevivir.
item.dc:creator: Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Ian Austen

item.title: My Rohingya People Are Running Out of Time
item.description: Genocide hearings in The Hague offer a ray of hope for the Rohingya, but aid cuts are worsening a humanitarian crisis in refugee camps.
item.dc:creator: Lucky Karim
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:credit: Adam Ferguson for The New York Times

item.title: Europa tiene una bazuca. Es hora de usarla
item.description: Si quiere disuadir los ataques de Trump, Europa necesita usar el instrumento anticoerción del que tanto se habla.
item.dc:creator: Henry J. Farrell

item.title: China Wins as Trump Cedes Leadership of the Global Economy
item.description: The president used a keynote speech at the World Economic Forum in Switzerland to renounce the last vestiges of the liberal democratic order.
item.dc:creator: Peter S. Goodman

media:content.media:description: “Everybody took advantage of the United States,” President Trump told an audience at the World Economic Forum on Wednesday.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Latin America Mostly Praises Maduro Ouster
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 22, 2025.

item.title: Private Autopsy Shows Renee Good Was Shot at Least 3 Times, Lawyers Say
item.description: Lawyers for the family of Ms. Good, who was fatally shot by an immigration agent in Minneapolis, have said their firm was conducting an investigation into the shooting.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman

media:content.media:description: A memorial for Renee Good was left on a snowy Minneapolis corner.

item.title: Trump’s Rift With Europe Is Clear. Europe Must Decide What to Do About It.
item.description: After President Trump aired his disdain for Europe, its leaders will gather in Brussels Thursday to take stock of what comes next.
item.dc:creator: Steven Erlanger and Jeanna Smialek

media:content.media:description: Mark Rutte, the NATO secretary-general, meeting with President Trump in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Jan. 22, 2026
item.description: Make sure you look both ways while solving Joe DiPietro’s crossword.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: ICE Said Agents Can Enter Homes Without Judicial Warrant, Group Claims
item.description: A whistle-blower group said a memo apparently signed by the leader of Immigration and Customs Enforcement violated constitutional protections against unreasonable search and seizure.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz

media:content.media:description: Federal immigration agents performed an operation to arrest two people at a home in Minneapolis this month.

item.title: Cuban Detainee in El Paso ICE Facility Died by Homicide, Autopsy Shows
item.description: The report from the county medical examiner said the detainee, Geraldo Lunas Campos, was asphyxiated and restrained by law enforcement. Federal officials described his death as a suicide.
item.dc:creator: Pooja Salhotra

media:content.media:credit: Paul Ratje for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Camp East Montana, a U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement detention facility at Fort Bliss in El Paso.

item.title: Former Uvalde Officer Adrian Gonzales Found Not Guilty of Endangering Children in Mass Shooting
item.description: Adrian Gonzales had faced 29 charges for his actions in the 2022 shooting, in which 19 children were killed by a gunman at Robb Elementary School in Texas.
item.dc:creator: Edgar Sandoval

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Memorials honoring the victims of the Robb Elementary school shooting in Uvalde, Texas.

item.title: Los blancos de ataque de Trump en Davos, uno por uno
item.description: En el foro de líderes globales, sus embestidas verbales sacudieron la sala con gestos de incredulidad y risas nerviosas.
item.dc:creator: Erin Mendell and Shashank Bengali

media:content.media:description: President Trump addressing the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday.

item.title: Illinois Investigates Claim That Landlord Tipped Off High-Profile ICE Raid
item.description: The state said it has opened an investigation into whether the management of a troubled South Side building may have called federal agents to try to help clear out Black and Hispanic tenants.
item.dc:creator: Jesus Jiménez

media:content.media:description: An apartment building in Chicago’s South Shore neighborhood where federal agents staged a raid last fall.

item.title: Rifaat al-Assad, Paramilitary Leader and ‘Butcher of Hama,’ Dies at 88
item.description: The brother and uncle of Syrian tyrants, he commanded a unit that killed up to 40,000 civilians in a 1982 uprising against his family’s rule.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:description: Rifaat Assad in his office in Marbella, Spain, in 2005. For more than 50 years, many of them spent in cosseted exile, he was an integral part of the family that ruled Syria with an iron fist.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ Would Have Global Scope but One Man in Charge
item.description: The initiative is the latest example of the president dismantling the post-World War II international system and building a new one, with himself at the center.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski

media:content.media:credit: Allison Robbert for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Israel, Saudi Arabia and other nations have said they would join President Trump’s proposed “Board of Peace,” but France, Norway and Sweden have said no.

item.title: An Unhinged President on the Magic Mountain
item.description: Trump’s Davos speech could have been ghostwritten by Mario Puzo.
item.dc:creator: Bret Stephens

item.title: At Davos, a Clash Between Trump’s World and the Old World
item.description: For decades, leaders have gathered in Davos to discuss a shared economic and political future. On Wednesday, President Trump turned the forum into a bracing clash between his worldview and theirs.
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs

media:content.media:description: Audience members listening to President Trump’s address at Davos on Wednesday.

item.title: T.S.A. Leader Defends Working With ICE to Congress
item.description: At an oversight hearing, Democratic lawmakers peppered the agency’s acting director over the Transportation Security Administration’s role in Trump’s immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Adam Sella

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ha Nguyen McNeill, the acting T.S.A. director, speaking to lawmakers at an oversight hearing at the Capitol on Wednesday.

item.title: Dozens Are Sickened by a Rare Fungal Infection in Tennessee
item.description: One person who contracted it died. The fungus is commonly found in soil in the Ohio River and Mississippi River valleys, and the illness is not contagious.
item.dc:creator: Adeel Hassan

media:content.media:description: This image created from a microscope in 1964 shows histoplasmosis of the lung.

item.title: Parents Sue Residential Home Over Abuse of Their Autistic Son
item.description: Anil and Shalini Babbar said they would not have known about the abuse their teenager was enduring at the home in upstate New York if a whistle-blower had not sent footage of an assault.
item.dc:creator: Hurubie Meko

media:content.media:description: Anil and Shalini Babbar’s son was diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder after his stay at the Anderson Center for Autism, according to their lawsuit.

item.title: Supreme Court Hearing Reveals Unease Over Threats to Fed Independence
item.description: As the justices weighed the consequences of allowing President Trump to fire a Federal Reserve official, the president reprised his pressure campaign on the central bank.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith and Tony Romm

media:content.media:credit: Caroline Gutman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lisa D. Cook, a Federal Reserve governor whom President Trump tried to fire last year over allegations of mortgage fraud.

item.title: Choque de trenes en España: así es como ocurrió
item.description: Dos trenes colisionaron el domingo en el sur de España, causando la muerte de al menos 42 personas. Esto es lo que ocurrió.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Granados, Ashley Wu, Raj Saha and Agnes Chang

item.title: Trump’s Talk of Greenland ‘Deal’ Framework Draws Mixed Reactions
item.description: A lot of confusion was swirling in Denmark and Greenland after President Trump’s bombshell of a post on social media.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Gettleman, Amelia Nierenberg and Maya Tekeli

media:content.media:description: People walking past a large mural in Nuuk, Greenland, on Wednesday.

item.title: Inside the Push to Protect Candidates From Political Violence Ahead of 2026 Elections
item.description: Two leaders of a political security group talked about what they’re seeing and hearing.
item.dc:creator: Nick Corasaniti

media:content.media:credit: Liam James Doyle for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A memorial for Melissa Hortman, the former speaker of the Minnesota House, who was assassinated last June.

item.title: Trump Says He Reached the Outline of a Deal Over the Future of Greenland
item.description: Also, the Supreme Court seems skeptical of Trump’s attempt to fire a Fed governor. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

item.title: RFK Jr., Kicking Off National Tour, Says He’s Not Running for President
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. rallied supporters at the Pennsylvania State Capitol, where he promoted his new dietary guidelines.
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. held a rally on Wednesday at the Pennsylvania State Capitol to mark the start of a national “Take Back Your Health” tour.

item.title: Judge Rules for Democrats in Push to Redraw N.Y.C. House District
item.description: The ruling, which is expected to be appealed, allows the state to change the boundary lines of a district held by a Staten Island Republican since 2021.
item.dc:creator: Grace Ashford and Benjamin Oreskes

media:content.media:description: The only Republican district in New York City, represented by Nicole Malliotakis of Staten Island, would be redrawn under the court ruling.

item.title: Heart Disease and Stroke Still Leading Causes of Death in U.S.
item.description: Deaths from both causes are down, but they still eclipse all other causes, according to new statistics.
item.dc:creator: Nina Agrawal

media:content.media:credit: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

item.title: Who Needs A.I. Music When We Have Bruno Mars?
item.description: Our critic Jon Caramanica on the smooth pop sound of Bruno Mars’s new single.
item.dc:creator: Jon Caramanica, Arjun Srivatsa and Joe Coscarelli

item.description: The Department of Homeland Security said an agent fired his weapon at a man who attempted to “evade arrest” and then “rammed law enforcement” with his vehicle in the Los Angeles area on Wednesday.

item.title: FCC Targets Colbert and Kimmel in New Crackdown on Late-Night TV
item.description: The F.C.C. said it planned to enforce long-dormant rules on appearances by political candidates on network talk shows.
item.dc:creator: Jim Rutenberg

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Brendan Carr, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission.

item.title: N.Y.C. Sues to Block Adams-Approved Police Reality Show With Dr. Phil
item.description: Dr. Phil, the celebrity psychologist, and Eric Adams agreed to collaborate on “Behind the Badge.” Now the city is suing to prevent the airing of “extremely problematic” footage.
item.dc:creator: Sally Goldenberg, Jonah E. Bromwich, Dana Rubinstein and William K. Rashbaum

media:content.media:credit: Adam Gray for The New York Times; Amy Sussman/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Eric Adams, left, gave the green light to a police reality show with the former talk show host Dr. Phil.

item.title: Austin Thompson Pleads Guilty in North Carolina Shooting That Left 5 Dead
item.description: It is highly uncommon for mass shooters to plead guilty in a country where such attacks seem all too frequent. The man’s lawyers said he wanted to spare the community from further trauma.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Medina

media:content.media:credit: Veasey Conway for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A memorial at the Hedingham Golf Club in Raleigh, N.C., in 2022, honoring the slain victims. The shooter pleaded guilty on Wednesday to all the charges against him.

item.title: The American Threat: Three Words I Never Imagined Typing
item.description: We don’t want our children patrolling hostile streets in Greenland or Canada any more than in Iraq and Afghanistan.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Kristof

item.title: Quick! What Are Your Dating Rules?
item.description: Advice abounds on how, when and whom to date. What are your best rules for navigating early romance?
item.dc:creator: Daniel Jones and Miya Lee

item.title: Federal Agent Fires Gun During Immigration Operation in L.A. Area, Officials Say
item.description: The authorities said an agent fired his weapon at a man in Compton, Calif., who was being pursued over a human smuggling operation. The man was not struck.
item.dc:creator: Jill Cowan, Orlando Mayorquín and Johnny Diaz

item.title: Military Police Troops Put on Alert for Possible Deployment to Minnesota
item.description: The move was described as precautionary in the event that President Trump invokes the Insurrection Act in response to protests.
item.dc:creator: Greg Jaffe
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Federal immigration agents in Minneapolis last week.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘Anger Drains Into Shame’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: Barbara Aronstein Black, a First as a Law School Dean, Dies at 92
item.description: A legal historian, she broke a gender barrier as the first woman to lead an Ivy League law school, serving as dean of Columbia Law from 1986 to 1991.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Schachar

item.title: Judge Blocks Government From Reviewing Seized Washington Post Devices
item.description: The Post, in its first legal filing since the government searched the home of a reporter last week, had demanded the return of the seized materials.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wemple

media:content.media:description: “The seizure chills speech, cripples reporting, and inflicts irreparable harm every day the government keeps its hands on protected materials,” The Washington Post argued in a legal filing.

item.title: Trump’s Moves on Greenland
item.description: After assailing Europe in a long speech at Davos, the president said he had won an agreement on the future of the Arctic territory.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

item.title: Iran’s Protests Have Been Completely Squashed, Government Says
item.description: After a crackdown that killed thousands, Iran’s prosecutor general said on Wednesday that “the sedition is over now,” vowing to punish those responsible for the protests.
item.dc:creator: Pranav Baskar
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A photograph taken during a tour for international news media shows a tax office that was burned during protests, on Wednesday in Tehran.

item.title: Trump Targets European Allies in Lengthy Speech at Davos
item.description: In a speech at the World Economic Forum in Switzerland on Wednesday, President Trump reasserted his ambitions to seize Greenland, but pledged to not use force.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:description: President Trump addressing the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday.

item.title: House Panel Votes to Hold Clintons in Contempt in Epstein Inquiry
item.description: The votes by the Oversight panel were bipartisan, though many Democrats said the charges were extreme given Bill and Hillary Clinton’s willingness to answer questions.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media:content.media:description: Representatives James R. Comer, right, Republican of Kentucky and the chairman of the House Oversight Committee, and Robert Garcia of California, its ranking Democrat, during Wednesday’s session.

item.title: Court Removes Restrictions on ICE’s Use of Pepper Spray, for Now
item.description: The Eighth Circuit granted the Trump administration’s request to block, for the moment, a lower court’s injunction limiting how federal agents interact with protesters in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith

media:content.media:description: Federal officers clashed with protesters after Renee Good was shot and killed in Minneapolis earlier this month.

item.title: 4 Takeaways from Supreme Court Hearing on Trump’s Firing of Lisa Cook
item.description: The justices were alert to the central bank’s crucial role and wary of issuing a broad ruling based on rushed briefing and incomplete information.
item.dc:creator: Adam Liptak and Colby Smith

media:content.media:description: Lisa Cook, a federal reserve governor, with her attorney Abbe Lowell, outside the Supreme Court on Wednesday.

item.title: America Is Waving the White Flag in the New Cold War Against China
item.description: Is a Chinese century now dawning?
item.dc:creator: David Wallace-Wells
